intro: Cassipourea congoensis, commonly known as the Congo cassipourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa, particularly found in countries like the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Cameroon. The plant is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Cassipourea congoensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
